Module com.therealworld.fitschedule
Package com.therealworld.fitschedule.model

Class SqliteDAO

java.lang.Object
com.therealworld.fitschedule.model.SqliteDAO
public class SqliteDAO extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SqliteDAO()
    Establishes a connection to the SQLite database and initializes tables required for the application, ensuring any necessary columns are added if they do not exist.

  • Constructor Details

    • SqliteDAO

      public SqliteDAO()
      Establishes a connection to the SQLite database and initializes tables required for the application, ensuring any necessary columns are added if they do not exist.

  • Method Details

    • createWeeklyScheduleTable

      public void createWeeklyScheduleTable(String weekStartDate, int userId)
      Creates a weekly schedule table for a user based on the specified week's start date. The table is named using the start date to ensure unique weekly tables.
      Parameters:
      weekStartDate - The start date of the week in "yyyy-MM-dd" format.
      userId - The unique ID of the user.

    • getUserId

      public int getUserId(String username)
      Retrieves the unique user ID associated with a specified username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to search for.
      Returns:
      The user ID if found, or -1 if no matching user is found.

    • getUsernameById

      public String getUsernameById(int userId)
      Retrieves the username associated with a given user ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user.
      Returns:
      The username if found, or null if no matching user is found.

    • populateTimeSlots

      public void populateTimeSlots(int userId, String currentWeekStartDate)
      Populates the weekly schedule table with predefined time slots for a given user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user.
      currentWeekStartDate - The start date of the current week.

    • insertWeeklyEvent

      public void insertWeeklyEvent(int userId, String timeSlot, String dayOfWeek, String eventDescription, String currentWeekStartDate, boolean isFitnessEvent)
      Inserts or updates a weekly event for a specific user, day, and time slot in the weekly schedule table. The method dynamically creates a table name based on the week's start date.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user.
      timeSlot - The time slot for the event.
      dayOfWeek - The day of the week for the event (e.g., "Monday").
      eventDescription - Description of the event.
      currentWeekStartDate - The start date of the current week.
      isFitnessEvent - True if the event is fitness-related, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid day of the week is provided.

    • getWeeklyScheduleForWeek

      public List<String[]> getWeeklyScheduleForWeek(int userId, String currentWeekStartDate)
      Retrieves the weekly schedule for a specific user from a dynamically named table based on the provided week start date.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user.
      currentWeekStartDate - The start date of the current week in "yyyy-MM-dd" format.
      Returns:
      A list of string arrays representing the weekly schedule, with each array containing the time slot and events for each day of the week.

    • doesTableExist

      public boolean doesTableExist(String tableName)
      Checks if a table with the specified name exists in the SQLite database.
      Parameters:
      tableName - The name of the table to check.
      Returns:
      True if the table exists, otherwise false.

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves all user information from the database.
      Returns:
      A list of User objects, each representing a user with details like username, password, email, and phone number.

    • getAllUserIds

      public List<Integer> getAllUserIds()
      Retrieves all user IDs from the database.
      Returns:
      A list of integers, each representing a unique user ID.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(String username, String password, String email, String phoneNumber)
      Adds a new user to the database with a hashed password.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the new user.
      password - The password of the new user (will be hashed before storage).
      email - The email address of the new user.
      phoneNumber - The phone number of the new user.

    • insertSchedule

      public void insertSchedule(int userId, String dayOfWeek, String eventName, String eventDescription, String eventStartTime, String eventEndTime, boolean isFitnessEvent)
      Inserts a new event into the user's schedule with details including the event name, description, start and end times, and fitness event status.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user.
      dayOfWeek - The day of the week on which the event takes place.
      eventName - The name of the event.
      eventDescription - A description of the event.
      eventStartTime - The start time of the event.
      eventEndTime - The end time of the event.
      isFitnessEvent - True if the event is a fitness-related event, false otherwise.

    • getScheduleForUser

      public List<Schedule> getScheduleForUser(int userId)
      Retrieves the schedules for a specific user for today. Today's day is determined using the local system's day of the week.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user.
      Returns:
      A list of Schedule objects representing the user's schedule for today.

    • getCommitmentsForDay

      public List<Schedule> getCommitmentsForDay(int userId, String dayOfWeek)
      Retrieves the commitments for a specific user and day from the dynamically generated weekly schedule table. Creates the table if it does not exist.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user.
      dayOfWeek - The day of the week for which to retrieve commitments.
      Returns:
      A list of Schedule objects representing the commitments for the specified day.

    • capitalizeFirstLetter

      public String capitalizeFirstLetter(String dayOfWeek)
      Normalizes the day of the week by capitalizing the first letter and converting the rest to lowercase.
      Parameters:
      dayOfWeek - The day of the week as a string.
      Returns:
      The formatted day of the week with the first letter capitalized.

    • isValidDayOfWeek

      public boolean isValidDayOfWeek(String dayOfWeek)
      Validates if the given day of the week is valid (i.e., one of Monday, Tuesday, etc.).
      Parameters:
      dayOfWeek - The day of the week as a string.
      Returns:
      True if the dayOfWeek is valid, false otherwise.

    • deleteSchedule

      public void deleteSchedule(int scheduleId)
      Deletes a specific schedule entry from the database using its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      scheduleId - The unique ID of the schedule to delete.

    • addGoal

      public void addGoal(int userId, String goalType, int goalDuration, String goalPeriod, String goalDescription, int goalCompleted)
      Adds a new goal for a specific user in the database, including goal type, duration, period, description, and completion status.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user.
      goalType - The type of goal.
      goalDuration - The duration of the goal.
      goalPeriod - The period over which the goal is measured (e.g., per week).
      goalDescription - A description of the goal.
      goalCompleted - Completion status of the goal (0 for not completed, 1 for completed).

    • deleteGoalFromDatabase

      public void deleteGoalFromDatabase(int goalId)
      Deletes a specific goal from the database by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      goalId - The unique ID of the goal to delete.

    • updateSchedule

      public void updateSchedule(Schedule schedule)
      Updates a schedule entry in the database with the provided schedule details.
      Parameters:
      schedule - The schedule object containing updated details to be saved.

    • updateGoal

      public void updateGoal(int goalId, String goalType, int goalDuration, String goalPeriod, String goalDescription)
      Updates an existing goal in the database with new goal details.
      Parameters:
      goalId - The unique ID of the goal to update.
      goalType - The type of the goal.
      goalDuration - The duration of the goal.
      goalPeriod - The period over which the goal is measured.
      goalDescription - The description of the goal.

    • clearScheduleForUser

      public void clearScheduleForUser(int userId, String currentWeekStartDate)
      Clears the schedule entries for a specific user within the weekly schedule table.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user whose schedule is being cleared.
      currentWeekStartDate - The start date of the week to identify the schedule table.

    • validatePassword

      public boolean validatePassword(String username, String password)
      Validates the provided password for a specific username by comparing it with the stored hashed password.
      Parameters:
      username - The username for which to validate the password.
      password - The password to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the password is correct, false otherwise.

    • authenticateUser

      public boolean authenticateUser(String username, String password)
      Authenticates a user by verifying the provided password against the stored hashed password.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user attempting to authenticate.
      password - The password to verify.
      Returns:
      True if the user is authenticated successfully, false otherwise.

    • getAllGoals

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Goal> getAllGoals(int userId)
      Retrieves all goals for a specific user from the database.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique ID of the user whose goals are being retrieved.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList of Goal objects representing the user's goals.

    • countGoals

      public int countGoals()
      Counts the total number of goals in the database.
      Returns:
      The total count of goals.

    • countGoalsRemaining

      public int countGoalsRemaining(int userId)
      Counts the remaining (incomplete) goals for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose remaining goals are being counted.
      Returns:
      The count of incomplete goals for the specified user.

    • updateGoalProgress

      public void updateGoalProgress(int goalId, int newProgress)
      Updates the progress of a specific goal.
      Parameters:
      goalId - The unique ID of the goal being updated.
      newProgress - The new progress value to set for the goal.

    • updateGoalAsCompleted

      public void updateGoalAsCompleted(int goalId)
      Marks a goal as completed by setting its completed status to true (1).
      Parameters:
      goalId - The unique ID of the goal to mark as completed.

    • getCompletedGoalsCount

      public int getCompletedGoalsCount(int userId)
      Retrieves the count of completed goals for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose completed goals are being counted.
      Returns:
      The count of completed goals for the specified user.

    • awardBadge

      public void awardBadge(int userId, String badgeName)
      Awards a badge to a user by inserting it into the badges table.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user receiving the badge.
      badgeName - The name of the badge being awarded.

    • getUserBadges

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<String> getUserBadges(int userId)
      Retrieves all badges earned by a user, along with their completion dates.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose badges are being retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of badges with their names and dates of completion.

    • initializeTotalGoalsCompleted

      public void initializeTotalGoalsCompleted(int userId)
      Initializes the total goals completed entry for a user if it does not already exist.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose goal completion total is being initialized.

    • getTotalGoalsCompleted

      public int getTotalGoalsCompleted(int userId)
      Retrieves the total count of goals completed by a user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose completed goals count is being retrieved.
      Returns:
      The total number of goals completed by the user.

    • incrementTotalGoalsCompleted

      public void incrementTotalGoalsCompleted(int userId)
      Increments the total goals completed count for a user by 1.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose completed goals count is being incremented.

    • fetchProfileDetails

      public UserProfile fetchProfileDetails(int userId)
      Fetches the profile details (username, email, and phone number) for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose profile details are being retrieved.
      Returns:
      A UserProfile object containing the user's details or null if the user is not found.

    • createFitnessEventsTable

      public void createFitnessEventsTable()
      Creates the fitness_events table if it does not already exist. This table stores fitness events with details such as user ID, event name, day of the week, time slot, and the start date of the week.

    • insertIntoFitnessEvents

      public void insertIntoFitnessEvents(int userId, String eventName, String dayOfWeek, String timeSlot, String weekStartDate)
      Inserts an individual fitness event into the fitness_events table for a specified time slot.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user who scheduled the fitness event.
      eventName - The name of the fitness event.
      dayOfWeek - The day of the week on which the event occurs.
      timeSlot - The time slot during which the event is scheduled.
      weekStartDate - The start date of the week, used to organize events by week.

    • getFitnessEventsForDay

      public List<Schedule> getFitnessEventsForDay(int userId, String dayOfWeek)
      Retrieves all fitness events for a specific user on a given day of the week.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user whose fitness events are being retrieved.
      dayOfWeek - The day of the week for which to retrieve fitness events.
      Returns:
      A list of Schedule objects representing the user's fitness events on the specified day.
